definition[0]: a reduction in the value or price of something
definition[1]: when the value of something goes down, usually gradually
example[1]: The proposed site of the factory may lead to depreciation of property value in the immediate vicinity.
definition[2]: when the value of a currency goes down compared to the currencies of other countries, causing imports to cost more and exports to be worth less
example[2]: A currency depreciation can have a serious effect on the domestic rate of inflation.
definition[3]: the gradual loss in value of a FIXED ASSET that wears out over a number of years or needs to be replaced regularly. Under tax law, the amount lost each year can be taken away from a business’s profits, reducing the amount of tax to be paid
example[3]: The calculation of depreciation for tax purposes is governed by the tax authority’s rules.
example[4]: Fixed assets are normally valued at cost, less provision for depreciation.
